So I've been doing a lot of my own research on SSTO's (specifically horizontal takeoff spaceplanes) and I've started to put together a little series on youtube about my tests.

Feel free to check it out guys, and offer up any advice or suggestions for what direction I should be moving in with my designs.

So I've been doing a lot of my own research on SSTO's (specifically horizontal takeoff spaceplanes) and I've started to put together a little series on youtube about my tests.

Feel free to check it out guys, and offer up any advice or suggestions for what direction I should be moving in with my designs.

Out of curiosity, are you planning on using the FAR Aerodynamics mod? If not, you may want to consider it.

While possibly making things a bit more difficult, it also makes them much more intuitive since the stock "aerodynamic system", and I use that phrase loosely, is so completely different from real world aerodynamics that you're basically left guessing as to what will work and what won't.

With FAR, you can use real world aerodynamics knowledge in the creation of your craft, even modelling them after actual air/space craft and have a reasonable expectation of success.

I might do a separate series for FAR. This one will allow people to build stock Spaceplanes.

Thanks for the suggestion though! I hadn't considered this
